newsitem.title: USA: U.S. weekly rice cash market summary -- USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. weekly rice cash market summary -- USDA.

text.p: In the South, rice prices were steady. Long grain milled rice price were selling mostly at $19.50 per cwt, Medium grain traded mostly at $18.00-$19.00, Second heads were steady at $14.00-$15.00 and Brewers remain in very tight supply with few quotes at $14.75-$15.50.
Rice by-products were mostly steady to $5.00 higher.
In California, rice prices were steady with Medium grain selling mostly at $19.50. Rice bran was steady.
California rice ship loadings: For the week ending Dec 7, 1996, at Sacramento the Samrat Rucaka loaded 18,303 mt of U.S. No 1 bagged Medium grain milled rice destined for Jordan.

Inspections of California rice for export: There were 414,719 cwt of U.S. Medium Grain milled rice inspected for the week ending December 7, 1996. The yearly total since October 1, 1996 is 1,622,313 cwt compared to 1,294,460 cwt a year ago.

The following prices were for domestic shipment -- offers, FOB mills, milled rice, dollars per cwt, bagged. (All milled rice grade 2 not to exceed 4 percent brokens, except California grade 1. All second heads grade 4 or better)
Feed by-products prices (dollars per short ton, fob mills).
